[{"number":0,"ids":{"trakt":60079,"tvdb":null,"tmdb":58476,"tvrage":null},"rating":8.5,"votes":2,"episode_count":143,"overview":"The specials of the British science fiction television series Doctor Who include the yearly Christmas specials as well as anniversary episodes, preview episodes, webisodes, and all other non-season episodes.  Also included is the series Doctor Who Extra.","images":{"poster":{"full":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/079/posters/original/6d8067d1a5.jpg?1420121602","medium":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/079/posters/medium/6d8067d1a5.jpg?1420121602","thumb":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/079/posters/thumb/6d8067d1a5.jpg?1420121602"},"thumb":{"full":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/079/thumbs/original/d9d346a996.jpg?1420121604"}}},{"number":1,"ids":{"trakt":60080,"tvdb":null,"tmdb":58468,"tvrage":null},"rating":8.13636,"votes":22,"episode_count":13,"overview":"The new first series of British science fiction series Doctor Who began on 26 March 2005 with the episode "Rose", which marked the end of the programme's 16-year absence from episodic television following its cancellation in 1989, and the first new televised Doctor Who story since the broadcast of the TV movie starring Paul McGann in 1996. The finale episode, "The Parting of the Ways", was broadcast on 18 June 2005. The show was revived by long time Doctor Who fan Russell T Davies, who had been lobbying the BBC since the late-90s to bring the show back. The first series comprised 13 episodes, eight of which Davies wrote. Davies, Julie Gardner and Mal Young served as executive producers, Phil Collinson as producer.

The show depicts the adventures of a mysterious and eccentric Time Lord known as the Doctor, who travels through time and space in his time machine, the TARDIS, which normally appears from the exterior to be a blue 1950s British police box. With his companions, he explores time and space, faces a variety of foes and saves civilizations, helping people and righting wrongs. The first series features Christopher Eccleston as the ninth incarnation of the Doctor, his only series as the Doctor, accompanied by Billie Piper, as his first and main companion Rose Tyler, whom he plucks from obscurity on planet Earth, and to whom he grows increasingly attached. He also travels briefly with unruly boy-genius Adam Mitchell, played by Bruno Langley, and with 51st-century con man and former 'Time Agent' Captain Jack Harkness, portrayed by John Barrowman. Episodes in series one form a loose story arc, based upon the recurring phrase "Bad Wolf", the significance of which goes unexplained until the two-part series finale.","images":{"poster":{"full":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/080/posters/original/94e2eafbd4.jpg?1420121609","medium":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/080/posters/medium/94e2eafbd4.jpg?1420121609","thumb":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/080/posters/thumb/94e2eafbd4.jpg?1420121609"},"thumb":{"full":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/080/thumbs/original/a9924ed8b9.jpg?1420121613"}}},{"number":2,"ids":{"trakt":60081,"tvdb":null,"tmdb":58469,"tvrage":null},"rating":8.7,"votes":20,"episode_count":13,"overview":"The second series of British science fiction series Doctor Who began on 25 December 2005 with the Christmas special "The Christmas Invasion". Following the special, a regular series of thirteen episodes was broadcast, starting with "New Earth" on 15 April 2006. In addition, two short special episodes were produced; a Children in Need special and an interactive episode, as well as 13 TARDISODEs.

This is the first series to feature David Tennant as the tenth incarnation of the Doctor, an alien Time Lord who travels through time and space in his TARDIS, which appears to be a British police box on the outside. He continues to travel with his companion Rose Tyler, with whom he has grown increasingly attached and is forever separated from him at the end of the series. They also briefly travel with Rose's boyfriend Mickey Smith, and Camille Coduri reprises her role as Rose's mother Jackie. The series is connected by a loose story arc consisting of the recurring word "Torchwood".","images":{"poster":{"full":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/081/posters/original/bcb00377f0.jpg?1420121620","medium":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/081/posters/medium/bcb00377f0.jpg?1420121620","thumb":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/081/posters/thumb/bcb00377f0.jpg?1420121620"},"thumb":{"full":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/081/thumbs/original/172ed0567f.jpg?1420121622"}}},{"number":3,"ids":{"trakt":60082,"tvdb":null,"tmdb":58470,"tvrage":null},"rating":8.1,"votes":20,"episode_count":13,"overview":"The third series of British science fiction series Doctor Who was preceded by the 2006 Christmas special "The Runaway Bride". Following the special, a regular series of thirteen episodes was broadcast, starting with "Smith and Jones" on 31 March 2007. In addition, a 13-part animated serial was produced and broadcast as part of Totally Doctor Who.

The series stars David Tennant as the tenth incarnation of the Doctor, an alien Time Lord who travels through time and space in his TARDIS, which appears to be a British police box on the outside. In the Christmas special he is joined by Catherine Tate as Donna Noble. The series also introduces Freema Agyeman as the Doctor's new companion Martha Jones, who leaves at the end of the series due to her unrequited love for him. John Barrowman also reprises his role as Captain Jack Harkness in the final three episodes which serve as the finale. The series is connected by a loose story arc consisting of the recurring phrase "Mr Saxon", which ultimately is revealed to be the return of the Doctor's enemy Time Lord the Master, first played by Derek Jacobi before regenerating into John Simm.","images":{"poster":{"full":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/082/posters/original/7e96887576.jpg?1420121625","medium":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/082/posters/medium/7e96887576.jpg?1420121625","thumb":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/082/posters/thumb/7e96887576.jpg?1420121625"},"thumb":{"full":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/082/thumbs/original/444df111ec.jpg?1420121628"}}},{"number":4,"ids":{"trakt":60083,"tvdb":null,"tmdb":58471,"tvrage":null},"rating":8.95,"votes":20,"episode_count":13,"overview":"Allons-y","images":{"poster":{"full":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/083/posters/original/ec1ba329dd.jpg?1420121631","medium":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/083/posters/medium/ec1ba329dd.jpg?1420121631","thumb":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/083/posters/thumb/ec1ba329dd.jpg?1420121631"},"thumb":{"full":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/083/thumbs/original/81624f139e.jpg?1420121632"}}},{"number":5,"ids":{"trakt":60084,"tvdb":null,"tmdb":58472,"tvrage":null},"rating":9.05263,"votes":19,"episode_count":13,"overview":"After his explosive regeneration, the Eleventh Doctor awakes to discover his TARDIS is about to crash. Emerging from the wreckage of his crashed time machine, he meets young Amy Pond. Still wearing the remains of the Tenth Doctor’s suit, ripped and raggedy from the damage after the TARDIS control room exploded, the Doctor promises to take Amy to the stars. But before they can begin their journey, they become embroiled in an alien plot that could destroy the Earth.

Later the Doctor makes good his promise and Amy boards the regenerated TARDIS, ready to take to the stars on a series of wild adventures that will change her life. Amy and the Doctor explore time and space, visiting 17th century Venice, France during the 1890s and the United Kingdom in the far future, now an entire nation floating in space. As always, wherever the Doctor goes, his oldest enemies are never far behind - the Daleks are hatching a new master plan from the heart of war-torn London in the 1940s. But they are not the only strange creatures the Doctor and Amy must face - there are also alien vampires, humanoid reptiles, old enemies such as the Weeping Angels, and a silent menace that follows Amy and the Doctor around wherever they go.","images":{"poster":{"full":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/084/posters/original/33a7c2165c.jpg?1420121634","medium":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/084/posters/medium/33a7c2165c.jpg?1420121634","thumb":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/084/posters/thumb/33a7c2165c.jpg?1420121634"},"thumb":{"full":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/084/thumbs/original/a5bde2ab8e.jpg?1420121636"}}},{"number":6,"ids":{"trakt":60085,"tvdb":null,"tmdb":58473,"tvrage":null},"rating":8.36842,"votes":19,"episode_count":13,"overview":"Complete with the series opener when together they find themselves in Sixties America, battling the invasion the world forgot, then journey on the high seas of 1696 aboard a pirate ship, to solve the mystery of the Siren. In a bubble universe at the very edge of reality, the Doctor meets an old friend with a new face, and in a monastery on a remote island in the near future, an industrial accident takes on a terrible human shape. They also venture across centuries and galaxies, where they encounter the greatest war criminal in all of history - and Hitler. They'll also discover there's no scarier place in the universe than a child's bedroom and a visit to an alien quarantine facility will reveal to Rory a very different side to his wife. In a hotel where walls move, corridors twist and rooms vanish, death lies waiting. But the Doctor's time has yet to come. He has one last stop to make on his final journey - an old friend needs his help and an old foe must be defeated. But time catches up with us all and the Doctor can delay no more.","images":{"poster":{"full":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/085/posters/original/7eca2529fd.jpg?1420121638","medium":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/085/posters/medium/7eca2529fd.jpg?1420121638","thumb":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/085/posters/thumb/7eca2529fd.jpg?1420121638"},"thumb":{"full":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/085/thumbs/original/63178e20b3.jpg?1420121639"}}},{"number":7,"ids":{"trakt":60086,"tvdb":null,"tmdb":58474,"tvrage":null},"rating":8.05882,"votes":17,"episode_count":13,"overview":"The seventh series of the British science fiction television series Doctor Who aired from 1 September 2012 to 18 May 2013, being split into two parts, as with the previous series. The series was broadcast concurrently on BBC One in the United Kingdom, BBC America in the United States, and on Space in Canada, and also on ABC in Australia, with the first five episodes released a week after its UK and North American release and the remainder released the next day. Following its premiere on 1 September 2012, the series aired weekly until 29 September 2012. Six episodes were broadcast in 2012, including the 2012 Christmas special, "The Snowmen", which aired separately from the main series. The remaining eight episodes began broadcasting on 30 March 2013. "The Snowmen" introduced a new TARDIS interior, title sequence, theme tune, and costume for the Doctor.

Doctor Who's seventh series was the show's third and final series in which Matt Smith, Karen Gillan and Arthur Darvill played the eleventh incarnation of the Doctor and his companions Amy Pond and Rory Williams respectively. Gillan and Darvill departed the series in the fifth episode, after which a new companion named Clara Oswald joined the Doctor, played by Jenna-Louise Coleman, remaining with the series for its second half. Smith stayed for one year longer than Gillan and Darvill, and will depart the series after the 2013 specials.","images":{"poster":{"full":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/086/posters/original/bf699c4790.jpg?1420121641","medium":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/086/posters/medium/bf699c4790.jpg?1420121641","thumb":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/086/posters/thumb/bf699c4790.jpg?1420121641"},"thumb":{"full":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/086/thumbs/original/dfd95b14da.jpg?1420121643"}}},{"number":8,"ids":{"trakt":60087,"tvdb":null,"tmdb":58475,"tvrage":null},"rating":7.5,"votes":18,"episode_count":12,"overview":"The season ushers in an exciting new era for the show as Peter Capaldi (The Musketeers, The Thick of It) steps into the role of the Doctor. Fans first got a glimpse of Capaldi's Doctor in November's 50th Anniversary Special, and again in the final minutes of last year's Christmas Special, but the upcoming season premiere marks the first full episode for the Twelfth Doctor. Capaldi will be joined by Jenna Coleman (Death Comes to Pemberley), who returns as companion Clara Oswald, and Samuel Anderson (History Boys, Gavin & Stacey) who joins the cast as Danny Pink, a teacher at Coal Hill School where Clara also works.","images":{"poster":{"full":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/087/posters/original/6355d34951.jpg?1420121645","medium":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/087/posters/medium/6355d34951.jpg?1420121645","thumb":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/087/posters/thumb/6355d34951.jpg?1420121645"},"thumb":{"full":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/060/087/thumbs/original/8ea073fde5.jpg?1420121647"}}},{"number":9,"ids":{"trakt":92093,"tvdb":null,"tmdb":null,"tvrage":null},"rating":8.0,"votes":2,"episode_count":1,"overview":null,"images":{"poster":{"full":null,"medium":null,"thumb":null},"thumb":{"full":"https://walter.trakt.us/images/seasons/000/092/093/thumbs/original/d9d346a996.jpg?1420211106"}}}]
